channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Largest Perl team in London with beautiful Docklands offices
item.description: Large, dynamic Perl team in Canary Wharf looking for mid-level and senior developers. Run by a Perl-loving CTO in beautiful offices with a great view over Canary Wharf, the company manages one legacy Perl codebase and a whole bunch of very new, very shiny, and very modern codebases that power the market-leading solution in their particular area.

item.title: Love independent music? Hipster not a dirty word to you? Drive forward independent music with Perl
item.description: Itâ€™s a friendly team, offering free snacks in pretty offices, and sending people to technical conferences. The company has lots of customers and is working on interesting problems. The team is looking for a mid-level developer to join them in their London offices, full-time and on site.

item.title: A role to give Perl Developers a warm glow... and powdered snow
item.description: If youâ€™re a firm believer in â€˜you only get what you giveâ€™, then this job should enable you to get an absolute shedload of stuff. Youâ€™ll be working for a company whose whole ethos is based around increasing fundraising for good causes.

item.title: Modern Perl developers needed to drive medical diagnosis into the future
item.description: A Cambridge-based provider of a revolutionary diagnostic tool for clinicians is looking for Modern Perl developers who are passionate about using their tech skills to help further the field of medicine. Youâ€™ll be building the tools that scientists are using to cure disease.

item.title: Thereâ€™s No Such Thing as a Free Lunch . . . Or is There?
item.description: Are you hungry for your next challenge? Hungry for a change? Itâ€™s only one click away! Our Houston-area client has several openings ranging from junior Perl programmers with 1-2 yearsâ€™ experience, all the way up to the 40-year veterans.

item.title: Barcelon Perl and Friends 2019
item.description: November 9, 2019 in Barcelona, Spain. A free one-day conference for Geeks and Friends

item.title: London Perl Workshop 2019
item.description: October 19, 2019. David Game College, 31 Jewry St, London EC3N 2ET

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: To compute a constant of calculus (A treatise on multiple ways)
A Quick One From The Atlantic
Is Perl 6 Being Renamed?
item.description: The hot potato.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge W023 - Difference, Factors and Poem
item.description: Ever since Yet joined the team, he has been pro-active in every challenge. A very inspiring member.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 23
item.description: Roger surprised us by solving the challenge in Postscript. When he joined the team, he used to solve in Perl5 then few weeks later he started solvung challenges in Perl6. Now he has done in Postscript.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge # 23: Difference Series and Prime Factorization
item.description: Laurent is one of the busiest members of the team. He not only just does weekly challenge in Perl5 and Perl6 along with blog but also reviews other members Perl6 solutions every week.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Week 23
item.description: Jaldhar once again came up with great solutions both in Perl5 and Perl6.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 023: Forward difference series & Prime decomposition
item.description: We missed Choroba's last couple of weeks. He is back with a bang again. You can't afford to miss it.

item.title: A Prehistoric Perl 5 & 6 Fizz-E-Buzz
item.description: Arne joined the team during thet second week of Perl Weekly Challenge. Therefore he missing the first challenge. With so positive energy among the team these days, he decided to take the first challenge as well.

item.title: Random Differential Decomposition with Perl 6
item.description: With his unique blogging style, Arne, presented his Perl6 solution in a simple and elegant way. Whether you know Perl6 or not, you are going to love his blog.

item.title: RECAP - Perl Weekly Challenge - 023
item.description: Review of last week challenge. There are plenty of great solutions.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge - 024
item.description: Don't miss the fun and try new challenges every week. For more information, please read FAQ page.

item.title: Shorewall 5.2.3.4 Released
item.description: Shorewall is a gateway/firewall configuration tool for GNU/Linux.

item.title: The MongoDB Perl Driver is being deprecated
item.description: Anyone wants to volunteer to maintain the MongoDB Perl driver?

item.title: The Wisdom of TAP Numbering in a JavaScript World
item.description: TAP started as a simple way to test the Perl interpreter. It can be used in other languages as well. For example in JavaScript.

item.title: Monthly Report - August
item.description: Reading about the accomplishment either makes you desperate as you will never be able to do half of it, or encourages you to do more than what you did last month. It is up to you. I for one, love it.

item.title: Stuart Mackintosh is new TPF President
Fastmail and Perl: an interview with Ricardo Signes
item.description: An interview with Ricardo Signes about his involvement with the Perl Toolchain Summit, and why Fastmail - his employer - continues to support both the PTS and Rik's attendance.

item.title: FLOSS Weekly 544 Perl
item.description: Randal Schwartz and Dan Lynch interviewing Sawyer X.

item.title: #423 - The new school-year starts
item.description:
Hi,

The school-year start today in many countries. At least in the northen hemisphere. So be extra careful on the roads to avoid accidents!

Besided that, enjoy your newly found free time :)
